alert.note: Alert for Morgan; Washington (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 23 at 10:51AM EST until February 28 at 1:00AM EST by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Ohio... Muskingum River At McConnelsville affecting Washington and Morgan Counties. For the Muskingum River...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY MONDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Muskingum River At McConnelsville. * WHEN...Until early Monday morning. * IMPACTS...At 11.5 feet, Flooding starts in cemetery on the southwest side of McConnelsville near State Route 376. More homes start to flood near the river. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:00 AM EST Wednesday the stage was 10.7 feet. - Forecast...The river will fall to 10.6 feet and then begin rising this afternoon. It will then rise again to 10.9 feet early tomorrow afternoon. It will fall to 10.7 feet and then begin rising early Friday afternoon. It will then rise above flood stage Saturday morning to 11.3 feet early Sunday morning. It will fall below flood stage Sunday evening. - Flood stage is 11.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 11.3 feet on 01/15/2005. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Report Severe Weather to the National Weather Service by calling toll free, 800 401 9535, when you can do so safely. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/rlx. The next statement will be issued this evening at 1030 PM EST.
